programme.title: Conan the Barbarian
programme.desc: A powerful Cimmerian warrior, Conan (Jason Momoa) carves a bloody path across the land of Hyboria on a personal vendetta. That soon turns into a an epic battle against evil, for Conan's mortal enemy, Khalar Zym (Stephen Lang), seeks the legendary Mask of Acheron. The artifact will enable Khalar Zym to raise his wife from the dead and achieve immortality for himself, but it will also unleash a malevolent force upon the land, and only Conan and his companions can stop it.

programme.title: Eraser
programme.desc: John "The Eraser" Kruger is the top gun in the US Marshall Witness Protection scheme; he erases their past and deals with their future. His latest assignment is whistle-blower Dr. Lee Cullen, who has evidence against a major arms corporation that's selling weapons to terrorists with the collusion of rogue enemy agents within, but there is danger nearer home for Kruger, from within his own department.

programme.title: The Hunt for Red October
programme.desc: Based on the popular Tom Clancy novel, this suspenseful movie tracks Soviet submarine captain Marko Ramius (Sean Connery) as he abandons his orders and heads for the east coast of the United States. Equipped with innovative stealth technology, Ramius' submarine, "Red October," is virtually invisible. However, when an American sub briefly detects the Russians' presence, CIA agent Jack Ryan (Alec Baldwin) sets out to determine Ramius' motives, fearing he may launch an attack on the U.S.

programme.title: The World's Deadliest Weather
programme.desc: The Category 4 Hurricane Maria is chronicled by a petrified student as it completely decimates the Caribbean island of Puerto Rico, cutting off power and water for months.

programme.title: Wild Japan
programme.desc: Stories of isolation, unique wildlife and unsolved mysteries surround a chain of Japanese islands which stretch towards the tropics - where all life is influenced by the power of the sea.

programme.title: Russia with Simon Reeve
programme.desc: Simon heads to illegally-occupied Crimea, where the region is suffering with drought after Ukraine cut their water supply. He then discovers depopulated rural villages that feel abandoned by the government.

programme.title: Joanna Lumley's Trans-Siberian Adventure
programme.desc: Joanna Lumley embarks on a 6,400-mile journey along the Trans-Siberian railway. Joanna visits a Chairman Mao-themed restaurant and is awestruck by the Forbidden City in Beijing.

programme.title: How Did They Build That?
programme.desc: Dutch engineers built a giant arch full of apartments on top of a swamp, while in China, a rock shaped opera house that pushes engineering and design using the most modern and ancient of techniques.

programme.title: Great Asian Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael begins his adventures in Hong Kong, with railway highlights including the cable funicular to the top of Hong Kong's highest mountain, the Peak, and the enviably efficient and shiny Mass Transit System.

programme.title: Great Asian Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo embarks on a two-part adventure through Thailand. Michael helps out at an elephant hospital, tries his hand at the art of umbrella-making and learns about northern Thai cuisine.

programme.title: Great Asian Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael continues his exploration of Thailand by rail, steered by his 1913 Bradshaw's guide. First, he steps into the ring under the guidance of champion trainer, Master Toddy, to learn Muay Thai boxing. Can he perfect the Cobra inspired right hook?

programme.title: Great Asian Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo boards Vietnam's spectacular Reunification Railway to make a 1,000-mile journey from Ho Chi Minh City to Hanoi. He visits the container port of Haiphong and finishes in Halong Bay.

programme.title: Great Asian Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels through the Socialist Republic of Vietnam. Near the formidable imperial city of Hue, Michael meets milliner Mrs Ngo, who teaches him how to make the iconic conical hat.

programme.title: Great Asian Railway Journeys
programme.desc: In the heaving megacity of Jakarta, Michael Portillo uncovers Indonesia's colonial past as part of a Dutch empire and its rich history as a port.

programme.title: Great Asian Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Beginning in Java's royal city, Yogyakarta, Michael Portillo visits the Sultan's Palace and witnesses the ancient art of shadow puppetry, known as wayang.

programme.title: Great Asian Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael rides one of the steepest and fastest funicular railways in the world and steps into a tropical paradise as he releases exotic specimens at Malaysia's first butterfly sanctuary.

programme.title: Great Asian Railway Journeys
programme.desc: In Kuala Lumpur, Michael tries the ancient art of pewter smithing and learns how the discovery of tin transformed a muddy estuary into Malaysia's thriving capital.

programme.title: Great Asian Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo's railway tour reaches its final stop - Singapore. Michael walks the streets of Chinatown with a local artist and uncovers the history of the Chinese community there.

programme.title: Monkey Island
programme.desc: Tensions rise when drought overtakes an ancient Sri Lankan temple shared by tufted grey langurs, toque macaques, and purple-faced leaf monkeys. Witness the drama as the lower-ranking primates struggle to stay hydrated amid a mutinous plot.

programme.title: Wildlife Icons
programme.desc: The food chain of Africa's savannah is a complex web of wildlife that entangles landscape-altering elephants, vast herds of antelope, apex predators, and a range of other species that have evolved to survive in this diverse and brutal landscape.

programme.title: Wildlife Icons
programme.desc: Follow a day in the life of a gregarious meerkat family in the mighty Kalahari Desert of South Africa. Led by a dominant female, the family must find food, tutor pups, and avoid predators in a scorched land where only the toughest survive.

programme.title: Wildlife Icons
programme.desc: Vital to the renewal of the landscape and deeply intertwined with the megafauna that tower above it, the industrious dung beetle is nature's ultimate recycler. Delve into the fascinating world of these tireless workers.

programme.title: Wildlife Icons
programme.desc: Though Africa's three big cats-the lion, leopard, and cheetah-live side by side, each has evolved a specialized set of hunting strategies that keep them from colliding. Take an in-depth look at the lives and stories of these iconic apex predators.

programme.title: Wildlife Icons
programme.desc: Life isn't easy for Africa's "big five" megafauna. Lions, leopards, buffalo, rhinos, and elephants face many threats, from competing for food in a limited landscape to avoiding hunters and poachers. Explore the incredible adaptations of each species.

programme.title: Wildlife Icons
programme.desc: Africa's charismatic megafauna receive a lot of attention, but the antelope have rich stories filled with daily struggles of survival. Two antelope species, springbok and impala, outnumber all the others and play critical roles in the circle of life.

programme.title: Wildlife Icons
programme.desc: Ethiopia is a land of extremes, home to mountainous highlands, vast river valleys, and parched deserts. And for each of these disparate environments, a fascinating primate species has evolved traits and behaviours that allow its members to thrive.

programme.title: Wildlife Icons
programme.desc: Lions may rule Africa's food chain, but other species have evolved strategies that give them an edge. Like lions, hyenas are powerful hunters that rely on strength, speed, and teamwork, but they've also learned to capitalize on other opportunities.

programme.title: Extreme Africa
programme.desc: Explore a corner of Namibia dominated by stifling heat and parched sand. But the margins of Etosha National Park are dotted with oases that attract herds of thirsty creatures, antelopes, exotic birds, plus the world's biggest elephants.

programme.title: Monkey Island
programme.desc: Tensions rise when drought overtakes an ancient Sri Lankan temple shared by tufted grey langurs, toque macaques, and purple-faced leaf monkeys. Witness the drama as the lower-ranking primates struggle to stay hydrated amid a mutinous plot.

programme.title: Guardians Of The Wild
programme.desc: Discover a new baboon species whose peaceful traits stray from typically aggressive baboon behaviour. At the Kasanka Baboon Project you'll see how life with these affable creatures is a soap opera, full of heroes, villains, and love stories.

programme.title: Guardians Of The Wild
programme.desc: Follow Madonna, the first Kinda baboon studied from birth to adulthood, as she faces the most important decision of her life, choosing a mate. New males compete with the troop alpha for her attention while researchers keep tabs on it all.

programme.title: Amazing Animal Friends
programme.desc: Support animals for humans are common, but when they support other species, things get a little wild. Meet a troop of monkeys who invite three rescue cats into their home in a rescue centre, and a playful dog who cares for a rescued calf.

programme.title: Orangutan Jungle School
programme.desc: There's watery fun with group two as they visit group three's flooded classroom. Ayu, Ruthie, and Kesi take a step closer to release. And the arrival of Alba-the world's rarest orangutan-creates a sensation at Orangutan Jungle School.

programme.title: The Big Dry
programme.desc: Many species call Zambia's Luangwa Valley home, but it has one of the toughest dry seasons imaginable-no rain for seven months and extreme temperatures. Yet for some animals, the dry season means opportunity.

programme.title: The Big Dry
programme.desc: It's October in Zambia's Luangwa Valley-the hottest and harshest time of year. There has been no rain since April and desperate animals are drawn to the only remaining source of water in the valley: the dwindling Luangwa River.

programme.title: Extreme Africa
programme.desc: Explore a corner of Namibia dominated by stifling heat and parched sand. But the margins of Etosha National Park are dotted with oases that attract herds of thirsty creatures, antelopes, exotic birds, plus the world's biggest elephants.

programme.title: Monkey Island
programme.desc: Tensions rise when drought overtakes an ancient Sri Lankan temple shared by tufted grey langurs, toque macaques, and purple-faced leaf monkeys. Witness the drama as the lower-ranking primates struggle to stay hydrated amid a mutinous plot.

programme.title: Great Lakes Wild
programme.desc: Squirrels leaping through the air is quite a sight, especially when they're seen in a surprising location. Typically found along Lake Erie shores, find out why warmer winters are causing the flying squirrel to move its territory towards Lake Ontario.

programme.title: Great Lakes Wild
programme.desc: Sometimes animals get a second chance. The majestic elk went extinct in Ontario, but a few years ago hundreds were brought back to re-populate the province. Meet one colony now thriving on a former prison ground in Burwash.

programme.title: Guardians Of The Wild
programme.desc: Discover a new baboon species whose peaceful traits stray from typically aggressive baboon behaviour. At the Kasanka Baboon Project you'll see how life with these affable creatures is a soap opera, full of heroes, villains, and love stories.

programme.title: Guardians Of The Wild
programme.desc: Follow Madonna, the first Kinda baboon studied from birth to adulthood, as she faces the most important decision of her life, choosing a mate. New males compete with the troop alpha for her attention while researchers keep tabs on it all.

programme.title: Amazing Animal Friends
programme.desc: Support animals for humans are common, but when they support other species, things get a little wild. Meet a troop of monkeys who invite three rescue cats into their home in a rescue centre, and a playful dog who cares for a rescued calf.

programme.title: Orangutan Jungle School
programme.desc: There's watery fun with group two as they visit group three's flooded classroom. Ayu, Ruthie, and Kesi take a step closer to release. And the arrival of Alba-the world's rarest orangutan-creates a sensation at Orangutan Jungle School.

programme.title: The Big Dry
programme.desc: Many species call Zambia's Luangwa Valley home, but it has one of the toughest dry seasons imaginable-no rain for seven months and extreme temperatures. Yet for some animals, the dry season means opportunity.

programme.title: The Big Dry
programme.desc: It's October in Zambia's Luangwa Valley-the hottest and harshest time of year. There has been no rain since April and desperate animals are drawn to the only remaining source of water in the valley: the dwindling Luangwa River.

programme.title: Wild Wild East
programme.desc: Wild Wild East travels to Prince Edward Island to explore the family life of the Red Fox. These sly creatures are adept at living just on the fringes of the human world.

programme.title: Wild Pacific Rescue
programme.desc: Join the vet and his team in saving a massive sea lion caught in a plastic noose, and then visit the Rescue Centre, where a harbour seal pup may lose its eyesight and a baby sea otter needs a risky but life-saving surgery.

programme.title: Wild Pacific Rescue
programme.desc: Battle wind and waves to find a sea lion trapped in a plastic ring. Then visit the rescue centre, where over 80 orphan seals must be fed several times a day to prepare for release into the wild, and see an Amazonian duck get a miraculous operation.

programme.title: Wild Pacific Rescue
programme.desc: Follow the team in healing and releasing a grumpy sea turtle, and then meet a sea lion with an unusual injury that must be taken by crane to the rescue centre. Find out how the vet aids an aging fruit bat and a community rescues a one-eyed seal pup.

programme.title: Dawn To Dusk
programme.desc: Follow penguins, iguanas, tortoises, frogs, and tamarins from Mexico to Peru and as far west as the Galapagos Islands as they live out their daily dramas, affected by the sun's heat, looming predators, and hazardous weather conditions.

programme.title: Dawn To Dusk
programme.desc: See how creatures from the Tibetan plateau, to the lush rainforests of Thailand, to Vietnam's twisted mangroves, survive four extra hours of daylight once a year, searching for food, fighting for dominance, and raising their families.

programme.title: Dawn To Dusk
programme.desc: See how one animal family's tragedy is another's holiday dinner as New Zealand's mainland and island creatures, including penguins, flightless birds, sea lions, and sharks, battle to feed and protect their young in this marine environment.

programme.title: Dawn To Dusk
programme.desc: Find out which creatures survive and whose luck will run out as animal mothers and moms-to-be struggle with sweltering temperatures, lurking predators, mating season, and drought on a day that proves to be no holiday.

programme.title: Dawn To Dusk
programme.desc: Live through a sunny tropical September day with creatures from Polynesia to the Indonesian archipelago. See how the sun affects the movement, feeding habits, and mating rituals of everything from tiny zooplankton to whale sharks.

programme.title: Dawn To Dusk
programme.desc: Celebrate the first day of spring with Aussie creatures looking for either a dinner or a date. From the kangaroos in the grasslands to the koalas in the trees to the freshwater crocodiles, they hunt for food or fight for breeding rights.

programme.title: Dawn To Dusk
programme.desc: Meet the unique primates and reptiles searching for water and dodging predators, from ring-tailed lemurs in the east coast rainforests to tiny brown leaf chameleons, in this land of extreme climate variations and habitats.

programme.title: Dawn To Dusk
programme.desc: Visit one of the most arid and hottest parts of the world to discover how dhub lizards and dromedary camels adapted to withstand the intense conditions. Then move into the more moderate southern mountains, where rare hyrax and chameleons forage.

programme.title: Untamed Valley
programme.desc: Dive into Kasikizi Lagoon, where hippos go to escape the hustle and bustle of the river bends. Meet other residents of this wild sanctuary, from water scorpions to fish eagles to marabou storks hoping to steal a quick meal before the oasis dries up.

programme.title: Untamed Valley
programme.desc: Battle the beachmaster, a giant hippo who rules a two-mile-long section of the river's biggest bend. Watch his fellow creatures evade the Nsefu pride of lions, who are looking for an easy meal, unless a Nile crocodile decides to steal their dinner.

programme.title: Dawn To Dusk
programme.desc: See how one animal family's tragedy is another's holiday dinner as New Zealand's mainland and island creatures, including penguins, flightless birds, sea lions, and sharks, battle to feed and protect their young in this marine environment.

programme.title: Untamed Valley
programme.desc: Battle the beachmaster, a giant hippo who rules a two-mile-long section of the river's biggest bend. Watch his fellow creatures evade the Nsefu pride of lions, who are looking for an easy meal, unless a Nile crocodile decides to steal their dinner.

programme.title: Untamed Valley
programme.desc: Leave the river behind and stalk the valley's grasslands. Explore territory that's home to a troop of baboons, a family of warthogs, and a solitary female leopard named Olimba. Check in with a nesting family of storks and fend off wild dogs at night.

programme.title: Dawn To Dusk
programme.desc: See how one animal family's tragedy is another's holiday dinner as New Zealand's mainland and island creatures, including penguins, flightless birds, sea lions, and sharks, battle to feed and protect their young in this marine environment.

programme.title: Dawn To Dusk
programme.desc: Visit one of the most arid and hottest parts of the world to discover how dhub lizards and dromedary camels adapted to withstand the intense conditions. Then move into the more moderate southern mountains, where rare hyrax and chameleons forage.

programme.title: Wild Wild East
programme.desc: Wild Wild East swims in the Rivers of Nova Scotia. Two species of fish, the Shad and the Gaspereau swim upstream to their ancestral spawning grounds, while a colony of Double-Crested Cormorants thrive on the mouth of the Pictou River.

programme.title: Africa's Wild Year
programme.desc: Welcome spring's arrival across Africa, and discover the life-giving gifts the season offers to the continent's plant and animal life. Get a close-up look at animal families raising their young, and celebrate their emergence into the wider world.

programme.title: Africa's Wild Year
programme.desc: Journey thousands of miles and observe the extremes that summer brings to Africa, from droughts and famine in some locations to abundance and feasting in others. Discover how this season tests the limits of animals and plants across the continent.

programme.title: Africa's Wild Year
programme.desc: Track autumn's arrival in Africa and the epic migrations it kicks off. Peer into nooks and crannies, where some creatures find one last romance before cooler weather descends, while others enjoy seasonal feasts ahead of the leaner winter months.

programme.title: Africa's Wild Year
programme.desc: Be an eyewitness to the death and resurrection that winter brings to Africa. Observe what comes with shorter days, from drought conditions to frigid winds, and marvel at the survival skills of animals and plants as they face the season's fury.

programme.title: After The Wildfires
programme.desc: Charting the long-term recovery of wildlife in the aftermath of Australia's catastrophic bushfires through stories of hope, human intervention and resilience, this film provides an urgent message to safeguard our environment before it is too late.

programme.title: Osprey: Sea Raptor
programme.desc: A veteran pair of osprey return home to a Connecticut saltmarsh. Over one summer they must battle their enemies, withstand the elements, and hunt hundreds and hundreds of fish, all to raise the next generation of sea raptors.

programme.title: Shadowlands
programme.desc: The southwest corner of New Zealand's South Island is hemmed in by giant mountains and the rough Pacific Ocean. Rare penguins are locked in a daily game of cat and mouse with giant New Zealand sea lions. The sea lions also live in a tumultuous world, wher.

programme.title: Shadowlands
programme.desc: In southwestern New Zealand, deep fiords and tidal lagoons are wrapped in green rainforest. The dark fjords harbour creatures normally found in the deep. As winter approaches, bottlenose dolphins must escape their freezing fjord, while in a mountain river.

programme.title: Shadowlands
programme.desc: The south-eastern coast of New Zealand are some of the richest fishing grounds in the world - the place for young marine animals to transition from novices to independent adults. Young whales, dolphins and seals learn to hunt, learn the rules of society,.

programme.title: Africa's Claws & Jaws
programme.desc: The harsh reality of life as a hunter is never knowing where your next meal is coming from. To survive, every predator must kill. Investigate the impressive weapons and attack strategies of Africa's specialized predators.

programme.title: Africa's Claws & Jaws
programme.desc: Snakes, spiders, and scorpions are the kind of creepy crawlies many fear the most. But in Africa, these species are refined predators. Explore the hunting methods, special skills, and secret love lives of these venomous creatures.

programme.title: Africa's Claws & Jaws
programme.desc: Sharks are among the planet's oldest and most highly evolved predators. Along the coast of southern Africa, pioneers dedicate their lives to learning more about these fascinating creatures and spreading awareness about their plight.

programme.title: Africa's Claws & Jaws
programme.desc: Lurking in the shadows of Africa is an incredible diversity of reptiles we seldom see. Masters of the underworld, these snakes and lizards have conquered almost every habitat on the continent while evolving a remarkable set of adaptations to survive.

programme.title: Wild Crusades
programme.desc: Hidden in the jungles of Sri Lanka is a charismatic monkey: the toque macaque. Each macaque is unique, from its facial features to social skills. With increasing human contact, see how the monkeys lives are being affected in unexpected ways.

programme.title: Osprey: Sea Raptor

programme.title: Nature Scenes
programme.desc: One half hour of uninterrupted footage of an adorable koala joey and its mom. Watch as this joey eats, sleeps, cuddles and explores high up in the trees. Animals in captivity filmed at Australia's Ballarat Wildlife Park.

programme.title: Strange Creatures
programme.desc: Keep your distance from these natural-born killers. Armed with venom and other poisonous tools that make hunting easier (and escape impossible), nudibranches, cuttlefish, giant centipedes, and assassin bugs are all dressed to kill.

programme.title: Strange Creatures
programme.desc: Examine the lives of creatures with really strange skills. From poison-shooting arachnids to ink-bombing octopuses to bifocal-eyed beetles, these animals use their powers to help them defeat predators and ensure their survival.

programme.title: Extreme Africa
programme.desc: The 1,200 mile Orange River is the longest in South Africa. Follow its westward journey, and see a diverse sample of wildlife from powerful swimming birds like the African darter, to flat lizards who inhabit the granite rocks of the Augrabies Falls.

programme.title: Nasa's Unexplained Files (S3)
programme.desc: Astronomers detect a potentially habitable planet tantalizingly close to Earth. A chance discovery at NASA reveals a top secret military space program.

programme.title: How The Universe Works (S9)
programme.desc: Journey to the heart of the M87 supermassive black hole, the first and only black hole ever photographed, and explore the mystery of how it grew so large.

programme.title: Blowing Up History (S2)
programme.desc: Now new discoveries are revealing its deepest and darkest secrets, showing how ancient magic, bizarre rituals, and brutal murder built this strange monument.

programme.title: Rise Of The Machines (S2)
programme.desc: We reveal the extraordinary stories behind the inventions hidden deep inside the DNA of some of the world's most extreme machines.

programme.title: Build It Bigger (S4)
programme.desc: The San Francisco-Oakland Bay Bridge is one of the world's busiest bridges, crossed by over a quarter-million people every day.

programme.title: How It's Made (S5)
programme.desc: Find out what goes into making CCD semiconductors, airline meals, paper cups, and trumpets.

programme.title: How The Earth Works (S1)
programme.desc: Martin Pepper and Liz Bonnin explore North America to find evidence of the most powerful geological events that Earth has ever seen - Ice Ages.

programme.title: Rocket Around The Christmas Tree (S1)
programme.desc: Three teams face off in a festive engineering challenge that will have them blasting trees into the center of Christmas Town.

programme.title: Sci Fi Science (S1)
programme.desc: A cloak of invisibility isn't just some Harry Potter fantasy -- Dr. Michio Kaku drafts blueprints for a real invisibility cloak.

programme.title: How Do They Do It? (S6)
programme.desc: Workers drill through half a mile of solid rock to get to the hidden riches underneath. Then, over 20,000 oranges are picked every minute to keep up with the demand for orange juice, and glass is curved without cracking.

programme.title: How Do They Do It? (S6)
programme.desc: The secrets behind keeping the world's biggest passenger planes in the air for 360 days a year are revealed. Next, workers harness the power of the atom to make electricity, and wood and metal are turned into musical instruments.

programme.desc: Find out how steel shipping drums, police whistles, miniature train cars and glass blocks are made.
